block.p: Anne Louise Davy and Timothy Paul Erblich were married yesterday by the Rev. P. Kimberleigh Jordan, a United Church of Christ minister, at the Seamen's Church Institute in New York.

Mr. and Mrs. Erblich work in New York, the bride as an assistant director for special programming and events at the Museum of Modern Art and the bridegroom as the national director for corporate markets at West Group, a publishing company.
Anne Louise Davy and Timothy Paul Erblich were married yesterday by the Rev. P. Kimberleigh Jordan, a United Church of Christ minister, at the Seamen's Church Institute in New York.

Mr. and Mrs. Erblich work in New York, the bride as an assistant director for special programming and events at the Museum of Modern Art and the bridegroom as the national director for corporate markets at West Group, a publishing company.

The bride, 33, graduated from Eastern Michigan University and is a daughter of Sharron and Thomas Davy of Frankfort, Mich. The bridegroom, 40, graduated from the University of Arizona and is a son of Joanne and Allan Erblich of St. Louis.
